Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from six fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat pottery plate; pale orange clay with white inclusions and some silver mica; cream slip, dark brown and red paint; exterior: bands, three below rim, one on mid-wall, one around foot; hook maeander band on top of rim; on floor, lotus flower and bud frieze and in tondo star of lozenges and buds; dividing bands with added red bands lined in white; red patches on parts of lotus flowers and on lozenges.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge NA47, NA52, and British Museum 1886,0401.1017.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. VII, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.749)
